text: this is kit Eaton for the New York Times
our smartphones are pretty amazing
things but they're also data hogs and
this can end up costing you but luckily
there are apps like data man next that
can help you monitor how much mobile
data you're using and thus hopefully
prevent you from going over your monthly
allowance and costing extra money data
man next which is a $2 iOS app is
actually my favorite of this type of app
I'm a firm because of its extremely
plain design which keeps things simple
and tells you all the information you
need to know on the apps home screen
after setting up the app for the first
time entering data such as when your
monthly bill is due and how much mobile
data you're allowed the out keeps track
of how much mobile data you've used and
displays a large percentage figure in
the middle of its screen it also shows a
text alert at the top of the screen and
if this says safe accompanied by a big
checkmark it means the Apple estimated
you won't go over your monthly allowance
the screen even changes color so you can
tell at a glance how much mobile data
you've used our great alternative to
this app which is also available on
Android in this case is called my data
manager while this app has the same sort
of clean minimalist design as data man
next it may actually suit more detail
obsessed users because it actually shows
more information about how much data to
using for example it even shows you on a
map where you're consuming the most
mobile data which could help you adjust
how you consume mobile data if you have
a habit of going over the top this app
sometimes a little fiddly to use but at
least it's free on both iOS and Android
a slightly more traditionally designed
app that does the same task is called
data usage which is also available for
iOS and Android it has some neat tricks
such as being able to track data on
shared accounts and on the whole it
relies on simple text-based information
and simple visualizations to help keep
you inside your monthly data allowance
data usage is free on Android devices
but costs one dollar on iOS and that's
it from me this weekend hopefully these
apps will help you from having a shock
the next time you get a phone bill
Oh
